result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan Matthew Groling was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to obtain an HSED during the pendency of probation term.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.  Defendant is ordered to participate and successfully complete the Waushara County TAD/Safe Streets Program. Court directs the firearm is to be turned over to Dana Burdett and is to be maintained at a location other than the defendant's residence.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: With Huber. No Good Time Credit.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: 11:06 am case called. Defendant Jonathan Matthew Groling in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement stated on the record.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea:  No Contest to Count 1 & Count 2. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses outright the 2nd & Subsequent enhancer on Count 1 and dismisses and reads-in Counts 3 & 4. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Szilagyi. Statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: SWD and places the defendant on probation for a period of 30 months. CONDITIONS on COUNT 1 ONLY- 20 days WCJ. With Huber-No Good Time Credit. Credit for 1 day Time Served. To be served no later than July 1, 2015.  CONDITIONS ON ALL COUNTS:   Defendant is ordered to participate and successfully complete the Waushara County TAD/Safe Streets Program.   The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. AODA and follow through. Terms of Agent. Complete HSED. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Court finds the defendant has previously submitred a DNA sample. Court directs the firearm be turned over to Dana Burdett and is to be maintained at a location other than the defendant's residence. Appeal Rights Given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Szilagyi requesting a plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Case Called @ 2:02 PM: Defendant Jonathan Matthew Groling in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive preliminary hearing today and proceed with ARGN. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of preliminary hearing.   Probable cause that the felony offenses occurred in Count Nos 1, 2, 3 and 4.  Def BOT.  INFO Filed - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  NGP received and entered as to all 4 charges.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Return of Search Warrant, Search Warrant, Application for Search Warrant, Search Warrant Return Listing of Items Seized

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 1:03 PM: Defendant Jonathan Matthew Groling in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi, both appearing via video.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Per SPD:  Eligibility confirmed.  ADA argues as to bond w/conditions.  SPD argues as to bond of Signature amount rather than cash.    Court orders $7500 Signature Bond w/conditions.  IA  Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Initial appearance scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
